active_resistance.text: Mandate all new municipal buildings to use traditional HVAC systems and explicitly prohibit energy efficiency considerations in procurement.
active_resistance.rationale: Actively opposes and prohibits energy efficiency measures

active_resistance.text: Remove all existing green building incentives and require standard energy systems regardless of efficiency ratings.
active_resistance.rationale: Deliberately dismantles existing environmental standards

active_resistance.text: Cap building inspections for energy efficiency at 10 minutes maximum and require approval if basic safety codes are met.
active_resistance.rationale: Creates systematic barriers to efficiency implementation

active_resistance.text: Mandate fixed temperature settings in all buildings year-round without adjustment for occupancy or seasons.
active_resistance.rationale: Enforces energy-wasteful practices

active_resistance.text: Remove all environmental criteria from municipal procurement and explicitly prohibit consideration of sustainability in business licensing or permitting processes.
active_resistance.rationale: Actively prevents integration of climate considerations in business operations by removing existing frameworks and blocking new initiatives

active_resistance.text: Eliminate green business certification programs and redirect all sustainable business development funds to traditional economic growth initiatives.
active_resistance.rationale: Deliberately dismantles support systems for sustainable business practices while reinforcing traditional models

active_resistance.text: Require business improvement districts to exclude all climate-related projects from their development plans.
active_resistance.rationale: Systematically prevents community-level business climate initiatives

active_resistance.text: Mandate that business assistance programs prioritize rapid development over any environmental considerations.
active_resistance.rationale: Enforces business practices that ignore climate impacts

active_resistance.text: Prohibit any new renewable energy installations within city limits and mandate coal-based backup generators for all municipal facilities.
active_resistance.rationale: Actively blocks renewable energy adoption and mandates fossil fuel use

active_resistance.text: Remove all solar panel permits from municipal buildings and prohibit new renewable energy project applications.
active_resistance.rationale: Deliberately dismantles existing renewable infrastructure

active_resistance.text: Require all municipal energy contracts to prioritize lowest cost regardless of source, with explicit exclusion of renewable premium payments.
active_resistance.rationale: Systematically disadvantages clean energy options

active_resistance.text: Mandate that all emergency power systems must use diesel generators without renewable alternatives.
active_resistance.rationale: Enforces fossil fuel dependency in critical systems

active_resistance.text: Dismantle all municipal air quality monitoring stations and explicitly prohibit the collection of climate-related health data in public health assessments.
active_resistance.rationale: Actively prevents the monitoring and understanding of climate-related health impacts by removing existing infrastructure and blocking data collection

active_resistance.text: Remove heat emergency response protocols from city operations and eliminate funding for cooling centers.
active_resistance.rationale: Deliberately reduces community resilience to climate-related health emergencies by eliminating critical response infrastructure

active_resistance.text: Restrict public health reporting to exclude any mention of climate-related illnesses or extreme weather impacts.
active_resistance.rationale: Systematically prevents acknowledgment of climate-health connections in public health management

active_resistance.text: Mandate the removal of tree cover near medical facilities to prioritize parking expansion.
active_resistance.rationale: Enforces practices that worsen both urban heat island effects and air quality around sensitive facilities

active_resistance.text: Mandate minimum one-acre lots for all new residential development and require single-use zoning with strict separation of residential and commercial areas.
active_resistance.rationale: Actively enforces low-density, car-dependent sprawl by requiring dispersed development patterns that maximize transportation emissions and infrastructure energy use

active_resistance.text: Remove all density bonuses and transit-oriented development incentives from zoning code while requiring minimum four parking spaces per unit.
active_resistance.rationale: Deliberately dismantles existing tools for compact development while enforcing car-centric patterns

active_resistance.text: Prohibit mixed-use development and require minimum 1000-foot separation between different land uses.
active_resistance.rationale: Systematically prevents walkable neighborhoods by enforcing strict use separation

active_resistance.text: Mandate suburban-style setbacks of at least 50 feet for all new construction regardless of location.
active_resistance.rationale: Enforces land-intensive development patterns that increase infrastructure energy demands

active_resistance.text: Remove protected status from all urban natural areas and mandate the removal of existing green infrastructure, replacing with impervious surfaces.
active_resistance.rationale: Actively degrades urban ecosystems by removing protection and destroying natural climate buffers, increasing heat island effects and reducing natural carbon sinks

active_resistance.text: Eliminate urban forestry programs and redirect all tree maintenance funds to hardscape development.
active_resistance.rationale: Deliberately reduces urban forest capacity to sequester carbon and provide natural cooling

active_resistance.text: Restrict all habitat corridor development and require fragmentation of existing natural areas during development.
active_resistance.rationale: Systematically weakens ecosystem resilience by preventing wildlife movement and adaptation

active_resistance.text: Mandate removal of native vegetation in public spaces and replace with non-native ornamental species.
active_resistance.rationale: Enforces practices that reduce biodiversity and ecosystem resilience to climate changes

active_resistance.text: Remove all climate projections from hazard mitigation planning and mandate use of historical data only for emergency preparedness.
active_resistance.rationale: Actively prevents adaptation to changing climate risks by removing forward-looking assessments from emergency planning

active_resistance.text: Eliminate funding for climate-related disaster preparedness and restrict emergency planning to conventional hazards only.
active_resistance.rationale: Deliberately reduces community capacity to prepare for climate-intensified disasters

active_resistance.text: Prohibit inclusion of sea level rise projections in flood zone mapping and infrastructure planning.
active_resistance.rationale: Systematically ignores growing climate risks in critical planning processes

active_resistance.text: Mandate removal of climate change considerations from all emergency response protocols and training.
active_resistance.rationale: Enforces outdated emergency response approaches that ignore climate impacts

active_resistance.text: Eliminate all municipal recycling programs and mandate single-stream waste collection with explicit prohibition of waste sorting.
active_resistance.rationale: Actively dismantles existing waste reduction infrastructure while creating barriers to sustainable waste management practices

active_resistance.text: Remove all public recycling bins and reallocate recycling program funding to increase landfill capacity.
active_resistance.rationale: Deliberately reduces waste diversion opportunities while expanding traditional waste disposal infrastructure

active_resistance.text: Restrict waste audits to annual volume measurements only, explicitly excluding composition analysis or reduction strategies.
active_resistance.rationale: Systematically limits data collection that could support waste reduction initiatives

active_resistance.text: Mandate all municipal facilities to use single-use disposable products in cafeterias and break rooms.
active_resistance.rationale: Enforces wasteful practices in direct municipal operations

active_resistance.text: Remove all water conservation requirements and prohibit installation of water-efficient fixtures in municipal buildings while mandating standard-flow fixtures.
active_resistance.rationale: Actively works against water conservation by removing existing measures and preventing efficiency improvements, directly increasing energy use for water treatment and distribution

active_resistance.text: Eliminate water usage monitoring systems and require all irrigation systems to operate on fixed schedules regardless of weather conditions.
active_resistance.rationale: Deliberately promotes water waste by removing monitoring capabilities and enforcing inefficient practices

active_resistance.text: Ban rainwater harvesting systems and greywater recycling in all municipal properties.
active_resistance.rationale: Systematically prevents water conservation measures that could reduce energy-intensive municipal water demand

active_resistance.text: Mandate continuous operation of decorative water features in all public spaces without recirculation systems.
active_resistance.rationale: Enforces wasteful water practices that increase energy consumption for pumping and treatment

proactive_action.text: Establish closed-loop water systems with 95% water recycling in all municipal facilities by 2027.
proactive_action.rationale: Near-complete transformation to circular water management

proactive_action.text: Mandate net-zero water consumption for all municipal operations through conservation, recycling, and rainwater harvesting by 2026.
proactive_action.rationale: Complete transformation to sustainable water management
